channel.title: Connecting to a Server
channel.description:
Ok is it just me or does windows 7 seem to suck? Lately whenever i try to run a client this error always pops
[code=actionscript]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Jframe Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Jframe at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run<Unknown Source> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged<Native Method> at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass<Unknown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> Could not find the main class: Jframe. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .[/code] the run setup for this is: [code=]@echo off title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause[/code]
Then when i switched to this for run setup: [code=]@Echo off ECHO You may now close this window Cd bin "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\Javaw.exe" -Xmx254m -classpath .;Theme.jar Jframe 0 0 lowmem members 32 exit[/code] It loads client up to "Requesting title Screen" then it says "Connection error - Retrying in 60 seconds" (time stats at 5 seconds then repeats all over again but time always goes up" Also, this only happpens when i try to run it on my windows 7 laptop..when i run it on my Windows xp hosting comp (its my server) it works perfectly fine
Does anyone know how to fix this? Please help

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:21, topic:391140”][quote author=Derosha22 link=topic=487088.msg3573990#msg3573990 date=1303266533]

What the hell is up with the posts on this thread?

The batch file can’t find the JFrame Class, that’s the problem.

and how do i fix this…?
[/quote]
Make sure you have a Jframe class?[/quote]
i do…

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

[quote=“Liquid Magic, post:15, topic:391140”][quote author=Derosha22 link=topic=487088.msg3569871#msg3569871 date=1302964071]

@echo off
title Client
"C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

[/quote]
your problem “Jframe”

edit: sorry. post editor is being a bitch.[/quote]
Im not sure wut u mean by saying your problem “Jframe”, I think ur tryin to say it shud b gui but i have a jframe not a gui so…not sure

[quote=“veteran god: king cesar, post:16, topic:391140”]i don’t believe Gui and Jframe are equivalent, i use a gui.java personally. But, OT:

If you’re sure you got the IP address fixed within the client.java, assuming you have correctly and successfully port forwarded and what not. The problem could be that you have separated your cache and your client files… were you attempting to make a webclient?

its possible your client just cannot locate the cache…

Good luck. Reply back with anymore info… :D[/quote]
I don’t think so because my cache is located within my client files, and no i wasn’t attempting to make a webclient ive never even played this server on my laptop, only my computer (the one that is running the server…)and ik i changed ip becuase i went to friends house and played the server on his laptop (not windows 7/64 bit)

EDIT: I have been doin some research myself and could it be because my laptop is a 64 bit, if so how could i fix that?

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

i don’t believe Gui and Jframe are equivalent, i use a gui.java personally. But, OT:

If you’re sure you got the IP address fixed within the client.java, assuming you have correctly and successfully port forwarded and what not. The problem could be that you have separated your cache and your client files… were you attempting to make a webclient?

its possible your client just cannot locate the cache…

Good luck. Reply back with anymore info…

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

mark033:

I think it’s client.java, I’m not sure. Use the search (I think the Windows 7 built-in one used for searching folders in the top left will work) to search for 127.0.0.1, which is what it should be to connect to the server on the computer it is hosted on. Change that to the other IP and it should work.

Ok thanks trying now
EDIT: Still doesnt work, says same stuff (Connecting error and cant find jframe thing still…) =
If it helps at all i can give u a dl link to the client just tell me if u want

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

I think it’s client.java, I’m not sure. Use the search (I think the Windows 7 built-in one used for searching folders in the top left will work) to search for 127.0.0.1, which is what it should be to connect to the server on the computer it is hosted on. Change that to the other IP and it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

[quote=“mark033, post:9, topic:391140”]Well that’s not a problem with Windows 7, that’s because you haven’t changed the IP on the client on the Windows 7 computer. On the Windows XP computer (the one you’re hosting on) open up command prompt (Start -> Run -> type (without quotes) “cmd”) and then in command prompt type in ipconfg/all. After that you need to find the IP of the one with Ethernet in its name, you then need to put that IP into the client on the Windows 7 computer and compile it. Then you should be able to connect to it.

Edit: That was assuming you’re using a cable. If you’re using wireless you have to look for another network connection instead of an Ethernet one.[/quote]

where would i put that ip into the client?

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

Well that’s not a problem with Windows 7, that’s because you haven’t changed the IP on the client on the Windows 7 computer. On the Windows XP computer (the one you’re hosting on) open up command prompt (Start -> Run -> type (without quotes) “cmd”) and then in command prompt type in ipconfg/all. After that you need to find the IP of the one with Ethernet in its name, you then need to put that IP into the client on the Windows 7 computer and compile it. Then you should be able to connect to it.

Edit: That was assuming you’re using a cable. If you’re using wireless you have to look for another network connection instead of an Ethernet one.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

Fridder:

Change jre6 to JDK1.6.0_… and try that. Whenever I was on another person’s computer who had Windows 7, they usually almost got this. Don’t know what causes it or how to fix it.

Ok i will try it in both setups. thanks ill tell you what happens
EDIT: Didnt change anything

Mark033:

That’s not the problem, the script can find Java, it’s just not liking his files. That sounds like a connection or cache (technically sort of still a connection) issue. What are you running/trying to connect to etc?

Im not sure what u mean by what am i connecting to?Could you explain?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

That’s not the problem, the script can find Java, it’s just not liking his files. That sounds like a connection or cache (technically sort of still a connection) issue. What are you running/trying to connect to etc?

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a Server
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

Ok is it just me or does windows 7 seem to suck? Lately whenever i try to run a client this error always pops

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Jframe Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Jframe at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run<Unknown Source> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged<Native Method> at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass<Unknown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> Could not find the main class: Jframe. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
the run setup for this is:

@echo off title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Then when i switched to this for run setup:

@Echo off ECHO You may now close this window Cd bin "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\Javaw.exe" -Xmx254m -classpath .;Theme.jar Jframe 0 0 lowmem members 32 exit
It loads client up to “Requesting title Screen” then it says “Connection error - Retrying in 60 seconds” (time stats at 5 seconds then repeats all over again but time always goes up"
Also, this only happpens when i try to run it on my windows 7 laptop…when i run it on my Windows xp hosting comp (its my server) it works perfectly fine

Does anyone know how to fix this? Please help

Read full topic
